result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett V Dennis

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Atty William Weiland appointed

2:13 PM 
Defendant Brett V Dennis in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brett V Dennis.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Cassidy calls the case and states appearances.
Matter set for motion for Atty Soule to withdraw as counsel.
Court inquires as to why Atty Soule has submitted a motion to withdraw.
Atty Soule notes that the defendant has requested a different attorney.
Court informs the defendant that he has a right to counsel, but not the right to choose his counsel that is appointed by the public defender's office.
Defendant states he does not wish to disclose the reason for requesting new counsel.
Atty Soule indicates that her supervisor has advised her to file this motion, but that she doesn't know more than that.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for withdrawal is granted.

Court indicates that the defendant will need to try and work with appointed counsel, as this motion will likely not be granted again.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Motion hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion and Order for Withdrawal of Counsel filed by Atty Taylor Soule (Sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/03/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Matter set for PTC on 10/10/2022 at 10:30 a.m.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:14 PM Defendant Brett V Dennis in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brett V Dennis.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of Attorney Kelly A Cassidy for the State of Wisconsin. 

Officer D Daneault is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mutchler.
4:18 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Mutchler would ask that the record reflect the witness identification of the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
No objection by Atty Soule.
4:21 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Mutchler and referenced.
ADA Mutchler would offer exhibit #P1 into evidence, subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Soule.  Received by the Court.
4:23 p.m  Cross examination by Atty Soule.  
4:24 p.m.  ADA Mutchler has no follow up.
ADA Mutchler has no additional witnesses or argument.
Atty Soule has no witnesses or argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brett V Dennis in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Brett V Dennis. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  With any Menards property, meaning their store, premise or parking lot.

1:14 PM Defendant Brett V Dennis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of WI. Atty Taylor Soule appears in person on behalf of Defendant, for today's hearing.

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of felony retail theft. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Public Defender's office will be appointing counsel.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
